This is like another recent font shown in this forum: too many good ideas! It's a great start, but I think it needs to sober up to become usable. Like "a"-"g" is great (although the "f" needs work), but the "h" -and then the "n", "u", et alia- introduce a new element, creating too much noise. Apply some "discipline", and you're there!

Hey Aaron.   
   
Pzb might benefit from hacking off the ascenders   
and descenders and allowing the troubled   
characters like the 'a' and 'e' expand vertically.   
   
Have a look at Büro Destruct's Eject:   
 [http://www.typedifferent.com/1998/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416040515/http:/www.typedifferent.com/1998/index.html)   
   
(Then send them an email and ask that they   
disable the cute, but ultimately obnoxious   
typing sound effects on that site.)   
   
Stephen

I think Eject is too 70s.   
Pzzzb's stuff is a lot less old.

apppreciate all the feedback. I am resitant to hacking off the descenders \< not that it isn't a valid solution, but i feel that that would be a entirley different typface. I might try the no descender ascender track at later date.   
For a different face   
   
thanxs

Is a nice modern font but i think that the "a" have problems. Please let me know if you are agree to let me put an example of this critique!   
   
Thanks, Miguel

Welcome to the forum. The face looks promising, but you'll find that many of these critiques start with this question: Can you set some words in your font and post a sample? It really helps to see the letters in context to know how usable it is.   
   
jb
